abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Republic of the Congo
            Economic Recovery Operation Project were as follows:
            outcomes were unsatisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was high, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) the time
            to get long-gestating public management reforms designed and
            started is before substantial resources become available to
            the government; 2) it is unwise to rely excessively on
            reform champions; 3) proactive supervision, always
            important, is critical to support major reforms in a
            post-conflict country with weak accountability mechanisms;
            and 4) technical assistance is unlikely to be effective in
            the absence of adequate government arrangements to
            coordinate the reform program as a whole.
